SGI had become dissatisfied with the
Bell Labs file system that was
implemented in UNIX and created their
own EFS or extent file system in 1985 it
was light years ahead of anything
available at the time supporting two
gigabyte file sizes and eight gigabyte
volumes in 1985 if you were lucky to
have a computer with a hard disk then 20
megabytes would have been a luxury let
alone an 8 gigabyte volume later on SGI
created XFS in 1993 and that was a
journaling file system which likewise
was over-the-top being a fully 64 bit
file system at the time when 32-bit code
was still in its infancy in the PC
landscape supporting file sizes of 8
exabytes which is still mind-boggling to
conceive in this day

GL but thanks to pressure from its
